title: Javascript Resource Descriptor
description: The JSON Resource Descriptor (JRD) is originally introduced in RFC 6415 and based on the Extensible Resource Descriptor (XRD) format

subject.description: A URI that identifies the entity that the JRD describes

aliases.description: An array of zero or more URI strings that identify the same entity as the "subject" URI

rel.description: The value of the "rel" member MUST contain exactly one URI or registered relation type.  The URI or registered relation type identifies the type of the link relation.

type.description: A string that indicates the media type of the target resource (see RFC 6838)

href.description: A string that contains a URI pointing to the target resource

titles.description: The "titles" object comprises zero or more name/value pairs whose names are a language tag [11] or the string "und".

links.description: This array has any number of member objects, each of which represents a link
